column4: hi, i'm on a lenovo t43p and watching youtube videos is quite resource consuming.. anything i can do about that?
if your vid is available in html5 that would be great, it would indeed be less resource intensive
ok i wll head for that ... also will do some investigations towards unsing minitube or vlc to play vids from youtube
no worries :) (good idea to download and watch them too)
i don't think minitube downloads it...
also vlc can stream the vid directly... just enter the youtube url as stream :D
vlc just has trouble with youtube again :(
fat32 has a 4gb max filesize limit, so ntfs is really the only option
afaic ntfs is not safe for linux writing on it
ntfs write support has been stable for years
ok... i once used it (i admit: was some time ago) and it really messed up stuff... never heard that it is safe to use... but you might be right
wow... minitube uses half the cpu compared to chromium or firefox... even when they are using html 5()
